etymology.description: 卩(卩) (jié, 'kneeling person') + small stroke (later 厂) to emphasize the knee -> depicts difficulty
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a kneeling person, possibly indicating hardship or burden. The character evolved from emphasizing the knee to stress the act of kneeling, metaphorically representing difficulty.

examples.chinese: 他正遭遇厄难(他正遭遇厄難)，并努力寻找转机(並努力尋找轉機)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhèng zāoyù è nán, bìng nǔlì xúnzhǎo zhuǎnjī.
examples.english: He is facing dire difficulties and is striving to find a turning point.

examples.chinese: 困境中有厄时刻(困境中有厄時刻)，机遇也随之而来(機遇也隨之而來)。
examples.pinyin: Kùnjìng zhōng yǒu è shíkè, jīyù yě suízhī ér lái.
examples.english: In times of hardship, moments of difficulty arise, but opportunities follow suit.

examples.chinese: 生活难免遇到厄运(生活難免遇到厄運)，勇气能帮助我们度过难关(勇氣能幫助我們度過難關)。
examples.pinyin: Shēnghuó nánmiǎn yù dào è yùn, yǒngqì néng bāngzhù wǒmen dùguò nán guān.
examples.english: Life inevitably brings hardships, yet courage helps us overcome obstacles.
